author: Robin Hankins
comment: I can't use my "perpetual" license for OS Landranger maps covering the whole of the UK unless I pay another £15 per device for the software to access them on a mobile device. I only bought the license in 2013 so that doesn't look like value for money to me. Bye bye Memory-map, I'll look elsewhere thank you very much.

author: Paco Murray
comment: I have been using memory map for a couple of years now with hema and topo maps installed. I find it fantastic of off road use in both car and motorbike.   Only reason im not giving it 5 stars is it need a night mode, even with the screen dimmed it is too bright to use in the car at night. Also a line from current location to waypoint shown on the map as the direction to arrow is  a pain to use.

The basic app is good and works very well at locating you on OS maps when walking. Licencing system is a nightmare if you change devices so getting access to maps you have paid for is difficult. The app has difficulty finding maps if you put them on an SD card

Basic functionality good. When switching map scales often fails to pick correct map file on SD card. Recent change to add dynamic menu bar at top of screen makes app harder to use and leads to'jumpy'display.  Much better at recording tracks than previously.

author: Harry Rigby
comment: Very useful for tracking cycle rides and kayaking and also geocaching. Yes, OS maps are not cheap but quality and you can buy only what you need. Disappointed that icons on Android are not the same as PC so you can't transfer mark files between them.

author: Michael Bowler
comment: Most times it works very well. The distance logging is not very accurate on the pull down view, but the mileage shown on the saved track is, so use this one. If your app is out of date or the android has updated, then the background map will not show fully or at all. If you are in the middle of nowhere (no signal) then it is too late to update the app. This feature causes problems. You need the map area in your phone that you are in or this does not work, unless you like working off the road map. As the whole of GB maps are a large size - GB HD is over 28GB - an SD Disk with exFAT formatting is required and unfortunately there are not many phones that do this. The GPS lock is very useful and immediately lets you know your position. The saved files are good and go straight into your PC program. Overall, very good when it works, a pain when it does not.

author: William McIntosh
comment: Digital mapping software.  It can be problematic when trying to change scales in areas with limited connectivity. I Presume the software is trying to verify your account, not helpful as many areas the mapping is used in has limited mobile coverage.  It's incredibly annoying when it changes scales to mapping you don't want to download but you can switch this function off (see reply below).  Compass is a bit wayward on 3 phones I have used but as I use the app for teaching I tend to ignore this function.

reply.author: Memory-Map, Inc.
reply.content: Tap Menu, Settings, General Settings, and turn off "Automatic Map Download", and "Change map scale by zooming". To fix the compass, you can google android compass calibration.

author: Tony Bowmer
comment: The app is as good as the device it is run on. On my Toughphone Defender Pro it has been excellent in the most isolated areas of the UK. On my iPhone, not so good in remote areas.

author: Stuart Flynn
comment: Excellent app. Not perfect, but I found it to be the best off road, offline mapping app available for Android.

author: Graham Trent
comment: I have been using Memory Map since my first HP PDA. To have the whole UK Ordnance survey maps on an SD card is great for cycling and walking adventures and you are not reliant on mobile data coverage. It is also very good for route planning on a PC.

author: James Bates
comment: I use Memory-Map a lot when I'm off-roading. I like it it's as simple or functional as you need it to be. Would like ability to view "mark", "track" category information. Currently only can only edit this. The abilty to view "mark" icons in the menu would be good.  Thanks!  Samsung user

author: terry archer
comment: Downloaded and then even when I reset 3 times password it still tells me my password is incorrect. Waste of time
This app provides all the features one would hope for from the ordnance survey. The presentation is clear and combined with the GPS on the tablet this is a superb navigational aid.

author: Sue Madden
comment: This is a great app for us and has helped us out quite a few times when of the beaten track.

author: Craig Leith
comment: Used this app for years and love It. Brilliant when walking running and out door activities
Pretty good on the whole
Brilliant for generating walk routes and following them.
Excellent as long as you are prepared to buy the maps
Good app, bit of a learning curve

author: Steve Spriggs
comment: Just nice and simple to use
Pretty good overall

author: Denice Wray
comment: Very good

author: Rob Willson
comment: Brilliant

author: Andrew Henderson
comment: I love the maps and marine charts but the licencing is  bit weird... transferring the licence between devices needs a degree in quantum physics and if you make  mistake you can never put the licence back on a device.  A couple of tools are missing for map navigation and the zoom levels are fixed but it is. Nice to have os  and admiralty charts

author: Stephen Lee
comment: Since the last upgrade I can no longer use self scanned maps unless I pay Memory Map £12.50. It's a damm cheek. If I hadn't paid for so many of their maps already so would go elsewhere for GPS mapping. I've heard good reports of the OS app. Update: the app also says that I have no licences when in fact I have two. Am I being ripped off or is this a bad upgrade?

author: Mammal Recorder
comment: I have been trying to use this for a number of years without success. I have only carried on because I have spent so much money on maps with them. In spite of that I am still regularly told that I cannot use a map I have paid for unless I pay again. All attempts to get a response from' customer service' are unsuccessful. DO NOT BUY DREADFUL APP DREADFUL SERVICE.

author: Brian Ward
comment: I've used Memory Map on Windows PC for a very long time but only recently bought an Android phone that could run this app. I was delighted to find I had little difficulty using all the maps I had bought for PC. I've rated it 5 star because it is so good to have proper OS maps on my phone and be able to log box breadcrumb tracks etc. However there is still room for improvement. As someone else commented, the map licencing is weird and the interface is also a bit eccentric. For example having to wrestle to get the data tab open and then having to drag this right down to find the button to start logging - this is bizarre, why not just put this on the menu? There are a few other annoying quirks like this, but overall it is just so good to have proper maps (no disrespect to Google maps intended), but OS maps are iconic, so 5 stars it is, but could still be better.

author: Adam Green
comment: For OS maps the digital rights management system is appalling. If you must use this system be prepared for time wasting frustration.  Marine charts have been somewhat easier to use.

I have used this in the UK and the USA where I am currently sailing. On my 7" Android tablet it is excellent as a chart plotter. Whilst not a software issue, I would warn against total confidence in a tablet/phone as a navigation tool. The PC version is great for planning.

author: Trails & Tracks 4x4 Adventures
comment: Quality of the maps is great (UK) it is let down by the protracted registration process and additional fee to use previously purchased maps that are not (reportedly) compatible. Oh and the storage and file / folder processes take some working out.

author: Matthew Wright
comment: On a recent trip had to reboot phone and on restarting the app it hung looking for a network signal. Same is true on a campsite with limited network. It just hangs on startup making it totally useless unless you have internet. Which is tricky if you're in the hills. Coupled with the irritating zoom which bounces about and wont settle where you set it,  missing features like elevation plots or proper route planning and details, leaves this as nothing but a very expensive home based map browsing toy.

author: Chris L
comment: This could be a great app. It's not. It's poor. There seems to have been barely any development on it since I first had it about seven years ago. The desktop app has hardly changed either. Shoddy :-(  Memory-map Inc.: your business will fail unless you spend some money on this, but it appears to me that is what you want as you can't be bothered with this.  In the absence of a response from the developers, I would suggest that no one subscribes or pays for this app. Shame, but there you go.

reply.author: Memory-Map, Inc.
reply.content: All of our apps receive regular updates and our business is doing fine, thanks!

author: Douglas Bagwell
comment: Have used app for about 5 years and it is very helpful for navigating on the  Chesapeake.  It has many aids very sophisticated  but can be used simply to tell how much water is u Der the keel. Have used all the navigation feathers and after a learning period it is so good at helping navigate an entered course. I use it on an Android 8 inch pad and would be interested in an add on module to connect to a NEMA 2000 NETWORK. DON'T know how this would work but am very interested.

author: Graham Dewey
comment: I originally downloaded the beta version of this onto my then HTC phone and paid for the map compatability module but in those days it was a bit buggy and not very stable. However like many things it has improved over time, so much so that I recently purchased the entire UK 1:25000 maps! On my new phone and also my tablet it works a treat. Only thing on my wishlist is a visible scale option to give me a clue of distance which is otherwise difficult to determine,  especially when zoomed in.

reply.author: Memory-Map, Inc.
reply.content: Thanks for the review! The scale bar was added in the recent update

author: Steven Redknap
comment: Really confusing app. Not easy to migrate maps. Have spent a fortune with memory map over the years and unable access previously purchased maps. Have had real problems with my latest Android phone

author: Phil Blaylock
comment: It could be so much better!  There needs to be an option to align to North (apparently this causes problems for marine nav but it greatly reduces functionality for walking). The GPS lock icon is too large.    You need to be able to see one synced track at a time (the only option is all or nothing).  If you have several tracks synced you can't tell which is which!  Discovered the full map doesn't fully download in the field with no mobile signal - apparently it can be done in a long-winded way, rather than a 'download full map' button.  Cloud sync is severely restricted unless you pay more money - would have been nice to know before buying a map.  I've an expired demo map and a bought map of the same area.  If I scroll out, it defaults to the expired / pixellated one with an option to activate, but apparently not one to delete it.  There doesn't appear to be an option to display the OS grid reference, just long/lat.  You can only choose portrait or landscape mode as you start - again, giving the option would be useful.  On the positive, HD maps are really clear.

reply.author: Memory-Map, Inc.
reply.content: Hi Phil, most of the features you request are already in the app.

author: David Sherborne
comment: Very good app WHEN OR IF you can get it working.  Instructions are poor and help is not easily found. Transferring maps is complicated.

author: D Scott
comment: Can't use any of my licences on my android spent a fortune buying them,they worked on my I pad until apple changed something,so transfers to my phone now I only get the road map,I should have OS 1.50 for the whole country so I'm giving memory map up

author: Anthony Watkins
comment: Only ever used the app on my android phone where it's great value. I get into navigational difficulties quite regularly through cycling and walking and this app comes to my rescue more dependably than others as it's so much less dependent on the internet connection. Also good for other tourist stuff; I particularly like the historical maps (for eg tracing old railways and canals), and the London A to Zs.

author: David Scott
comment: Potentially a good app, but when they updated it they stopped nearly all the maps I had purchased with the earlier desktop version from working. These cost a lot and I do not wish to buy newer versions, especially if these too will be deactivated at some point.
